OVERVIEW:
Landscape--hills
Landform--hillslopes
Slope--1 to 40 percent
Parent material-colluvium derived from obsidian and rhyolite
Mean annual precipitation--about 475 mm
Mean annual air temperature--about 3 degrees C
Depth class--very deep
Drainage class--well drained
Soil moisture regime--xeric
Soil temperature regime--cryic

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-loamy over sandy or sandy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Xeric Haplocryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Anteloperidge sandy loam in an area of rangeland (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
A1--0 to 8 cm; brown (10YR 4/3) sandy loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine granular; soft, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; common very fine and fine and few medium roots; few fine tubular pores; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 6.8); clear wavy boundary.
A2--8 to 25 cm; dark brown (10YR 3/3) sandy loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak medium and fine subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; common very fine and fine and few medium roots; few very fine tubular pores; 5 percent gravel; neutral (pH 6.8); abrupt wavy boundary.
Bw1--25 to 48 cm; light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) sandy loam, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine subangular blocky; soft, friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; few very fine, fine, and medium roots; few very fine tubular pores; 10 percent gravel; neutral (pH 7.2); clear wavy boundary.
Bw2--48 to 75 cm; yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) gravelly coarse sandy loam, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine subangular blocky; soft, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; few very fine and fine roots; few fine tubular pores; 15 percent gravel; slightly alkaline (pH 7.4); clear wavy boundary.
2CB--75 to 107 cm; light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) gravelly sand, 70 percent black (7.5YR 2.5/1) and 30 percent dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; few very fine, fine, and medium roots; few very fine tubular pores; 15 percent gravel; slightly alkaline (pH 7.4); gradual wavy boundary.
2C1--107 to 135 cm; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) gravelly sand, 60 percent black (7.5YR 2.5/1) and 40 percent dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; single grain; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; many fine interstitial pores; 20 percent gravel and 5 percent cobbles; slightly alkaline (pH 7.6); clear smooth boundary.
2C2--135 to 150 cm; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) very gravelly sand, 60 percent black (7.5YR 2.5/1) and 40 percent dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; single grain; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; many fine interstitial pores; 30 percent gravel and 15 percent cobbles; slightly alkaline (pH 7.6).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Clark County, Idaho, about 4.4 km north of Kilgore, Idaho; about 188 m east and 404 m south of the northwest corner of section 24, T. 13 N., R. 39 E.; Antelope Valley U.S. Geological Survey quadrangle; latitude 44.442 degrees north, longitude 111.81742 degrees west, datum WGS 84 (coordinates determined with a GPS)

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--2.8 to 6.1 degrees C
Thickness of mollic epipedon--25 to 40 cm
Depth to lithologic discontinuity--50 to 100 cm
Particle-size control section (weighted averages)
Clay content--8 to 15 percent
Total rock fragment content--10 to 35 percent
A horizon
Hue--10YR, 7.5YR
Value--3 or 4 dry, 2 or 3 moist
Chroma--2 or 3 dry or moist
Clay content--6 to 12 percent
Gravel content--5 to 10 percent
Reaction--pH 6.1 to 7.3
Thickness--25 to 40 cm
Bw horizon
Hue--10YR, 7.5YR
Value--4 to 6 dry, 3 or 4 moist
Chroma--2 to 4 dry or moist
Texture (less than 2-mm fraction)--sandy loam, coarse sandy loam, coarse loamy sand
Clay content--11 to 18 percent
Total fine sand or coarser material, by weight--35 to 50 percent
Gravel content--10 to 30 percent
Reaction--pH 6.6 to 7.8
Thickness--25 to 74 cm
2CB horizon
Hue--10YR or 7.5YR dry or moist
Value--2 to 6 dry or moist
Chroma--1 to 5 dry or moist
Texture (less than 2-mm fraction)--sand, loamy coarse sand, coarse sand
Clay content--2 to 10 percent
Total fine sand or coarser material, by weight--60 to 90 percent
Gravel content--15 to 45 percent
Reaction--pH 6.6 to 7.8
Thickness--30 to 43 cm
2C horizon
Hue--10YR or 7.5YR dry or moist
Value--2 to 5 dry or moist
Chroma--1 to 3 dry or moist
Texture (less than 2-mm fraction)--sand, loamy coarse sand, coarse sand
Clay content--2 to 10 percent
Total rock fragment content--25 to 70 percent
Gravel content--20 to 45 percent
Cobble content--5 to 25 percent
Reaction--pH 6.6 to 7.8

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--1930 to 2070 m
Mean annual precipitation--400 to 560 mm
Mean annual air temperature--1.7 to 5.6 degrees C
Frost-free period--30 to 50 days

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--well drained
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--10 to 100 um/sec in upper part, 300 to 400 um/sec in lower part

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Major uses--rangeland, wildlife habitat
Potential natural vegetation--mountain big sagebrush, antelope bitterbrush, bluebunch wheatgrass, Idaho fescue, arrowleaf balsamroot, Columbia needlegrass, slender wheatgrass

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Small extent in southeastern Idaho; MLRA 13

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE:  Portland, Oregon

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
Mollic epipedon--zone from the surface to a depth of 25 cm
Cambic horizon--zone from 25 to 75 cm
Particle-size control section--zone from 25 to 100 cm
Taxonomic version--Twelfth Edition, 2014
